intro: Epicion, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are herbaceous perennials with grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or greenish in color. Epicion species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. They have a long flowering period, typically from late spring to early summer.
